instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Fan spin only when the SMC is warm
threads.message: I'm working on a 820-3437 board. It had no green light. After some mesures, I conclued to change the SMC. I did change the SMC : green light, fan spin while the SMC area still warm. But after the board get cool the fan does spin anymore but I still have the green light. So I changed again the SMC, and I still have the same issue after the board get cool. Does somebody has a clue please ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Fan spin only when the SMC is warm
threads.message:
Diode mode on pin 2 of R6061? Are you sure it is not just a flaky fan, that is common.
Did you use an SMC from exact same board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Fan spin only when the SMC is warm
threads.message:
Diode mode on pin 2 of R6061 : 0.715
The fan is all right, even then, the board does't turn on at all, no shime, no screen.
I used two differents SMC from the same board, same issue : fan spin turn on when the SMC still warm

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Fan spin only when the SMC is warm
threads.message: I checked the soldering of the SMC, it look's bad. I'm going to do it again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Fan spin only when the SMC is warm
threads.message: I found the solution. SMC soldering was good, the problem was comming from dirt on Q3088. So I took of this element, clean the pads, soldered back. And now it's working. Thanks Dukefawks for the advices.
